intro: Gnaphalium kurmense, commonly known as Kurmian everlasting, is a flowering plant native to Central Asia. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant produces small, white to pale yellow florets arranged in a compact, button-like cluster. It thrives in arid and semi-arid environments, often found in rocky or sandy soils. Gnaphalium kurmense is known for its aromatic leaves and is sometimes used in traditional medicine.
